questions.question_text: Which protocol should be used to transfer large files on a company intranet that allows TCP 20 and 21 through the firewall?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
FTP (File Transfer Protocol) uses TCP ports 20 and 21 for transferring files. It is designed for reliable, large file transfers and is commonly used on company intranets when these ports are open.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. What is the cause of poor performance on router R19?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The key indicator in the output is the "Total output drops: 135298429". This suggests a significant number of packets are being dropped because the interface cannot handle the traffic, which is typically due to port oversubscription (answer C).

While there are some CRC errors and collisions, these numbers are much smaller compared to the massive number of output drops, which points toward the port being overwhelmed with traffic, a classic sign of oversubscription rather than issues like collisions or CRC errors.

So the correct answer is C. port oversubscription.

this output was taken after they were finished pushing the traffic, i believe thats why we dont see anything in the output queue (if it were happening in realtime, we would see the output queue max out as well to give more indication) which is somewhat fair, sometimes when we investigate an issue, it isnt happening in realtime anymore, but we still need to solve it.

Selected Answer: C
snowwhiteyeti comment seems legit

Selected Answer: D
This show interface output is strange.

Selected Answer: D
Given answer is correct

Selected Answer: D
Ref: If UDP Isn’t Error-Free, Why Is It Perfect for Streaming? - Crazy Egg

"...
UDP Overview | User Datagram Protocol

UDP is a connectionless transport network protocol. As such, it doesn’t establish a “handshake” connection between the sender and receiver before transmitting data. Still, when combined with IP, the UDP/IP suite enables communication between two devices over a network.
...
From a technical standpoint, UDP is “unreliable” for several reasons, but mostly because it doesn’t guarantee packet delivery. Instead, it sends data without confirming if it arrived at the destination. This makes it fast, but imperfect.

In practice, UDP is suitable for applications that require low latency and can tolerate some degree of packet loss. It’s most commonly used for VoIP calls, live audio or video streaming, and online gaming. All of these activities require a steady data flow moving as quickly as possible.
..."

choices.A: UDP uses sequencing data for packets to arrive in order, and TCP offers the capability to receive packets in random order.
choices.C: UDP reliably guarantees delivery of all packets, and TCP drops packets under heavy load.
choices.B: TCP uses congestion control for efficient packet delivery, and UDP uses flow control mechanisms for the delivery of packets
choices.D: TCP sends an acknowledgment for every packet that is received, and UDP operates without acknowledgments.

questions.question_text: Why is UDP more suitable than TCP for applications that require low latency, such as VoIP?

//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. Which switch in this configuration will be elected as the root bridge?


SW1: 0С:0А:05:22:05:97 -

SW2: 0C:0A:A8:1A:3C:9D -

SW3: 0С:0А:18:81:ВЗ:19 -
SW4: 0С:4А:82:56:35:78

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Answer definitely C, first check lowest priority then check lowest mac addresss
Answer definitely C, first check lowest priority then check lowest mac address

Selected Answer: C
Lowest Priority then MAC Address.

Selected Answer: C
Ref: Spanning Tree Root Bridge Election on Cisco Switches – FlackBox

“The Root Bridge Election
…
You can manipulate the Root Bridge Election by setting Bridge priority on your switches. The default value is 32768, and the lowest number is preferred. In the case of a tie, the switch with the lowest MAC address will be selected.
…”

Selected Answer: C
Answer is C
Priority tie leads to comparing MACs (SW3 has a lower MAC)

C

The MAC address of SW3 (0C:0A:18:81:B3:19) is lower than that of SW2 (0C:0A:A8:1A:3C:9D), so:

SW3 will be elected as the root bridge.
